item.title: Report X-2023082070
item.description:
Report X-2023082070

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-27T18:15:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-28
  • City: PLATTSBURGH
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: We received a trailer from the Syracuse facility. When opened the HAZMAT was discovered on the bottom of an entire wall of the trailer under immense pressure from all the other packages on top. The package handler that was assigned to the trailer at the time had seen this event and called out that there was a leaking HAZMAT present inside the trailer. A manager then advised them to step out of the trailer and continue working elsewhere. After it was discovered the QA employee at the time went over with a HAZMAT bucket and picked it up and swiftly put the HAZMAT in a salvage drum. The proper steps were NOT followed completely. The SDS was never pulled when it was found leaking. DescribePack: When inspected later on the next day, it was discovered that a leaking cap was causing the slow leak. The weight from other packages on top of the HAZMAT caused a cap to come loose. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately placed in a salvage drum

item.title: Report X-2023082063
item.description:
Report X-2023082063

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-27T18:15:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-24
  • City: LONG ISLAND CITY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: 1 drum was found with cap loose from the drum. The drum was put into the hazmat area and put it in the plastic bag. DescribePack: The cap of the drum was loose and unable to closed. The cap was pressed on by speciality tool and can not be resealed. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Kitty litter was used to prevent the spillage.

item.title: Report X-2023082041
item.description:
Report X-2023082041

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-26T18:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-28
  • City: NEWBURGH
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: ITEM WAS PULLED FROM TRAILER AND PULLED AWAY FROM UNLOAD AND PLACED IN A BIN FOR HAZMATS DescribePack: QA WAS CALLED TO THE BELT TO CHECK ON PACKAGE UPON FURTHER INSPECTION QA SAW THAT THE CAP WAS LOOSE ON THE CAN INSIDE, ITEM DOESNT LEAK UNLESS TURNED UPSIDEDOWN WHICH IN TURN WAS DUE TO BAD HANDLING ITEMS WERE REPACKED IN A DRUM WAITING FOR DESPOSITION DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA WAS CALLED TO ASSESS PACKAGE AND CLEAN AREA
